titles.title: FinCen Public Accountability Act

To amend title 31, United States Code, to require the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network established by the Secretary of the Treasury to allow an individual to obtain a copy of any record maintained by the Network pertaining to such person and to have corrections made to such records, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 2/3/1999--Introduced. FinCen Public Accountability Act - Amends Federal law governing records and reports on monetary instruments transactions to set within the purview of the Privacy Act of 1974 certain records maintained by the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCen). Denies the Secretary of the Treasury any authority to exempt FinCen from such Act. Permits the Secretary to impose user fees upon a governmental entity which accesses information from FinCen.
